qas.question: Who created an investigation into whether or not the Soviet-German Pact happened?
Which states have argued that the Soviet-German Pact was invalid from the inception?

answers.text: Both successor-states of the pact parties

qas.question: Which government agency received the news that the Soviet-German Pact had existed?

answers.text: Congress of People's Deputies of the Soviet Union

qas.question: Who rejected an investigation into whether or not the Soviet-German Pact happened?

plausible_answers.text: Both successor-states of the pact parties

qas.question: Which states have argued that the Soviet-German Pact was valid from the inception?

plausible_answers.text: Both successor-states of the pact parties

qas.question: Which states have argued that the Japan-German Pact was invalid from the inception?

plausible_answers.text: Congress of People's Deputies of the Soviet Union

qas.question: Which non-government agency received the news that the Soviet-German Pact had existed?

plausible_answers.text: Congress of People's Deputies of the Soviet Union

qas.question: Which government agency received the news that the Soviet-German Pact had never existed?

context: For decades, it was the official policy of the Soviet Union to deny the existence of the secret protocol to the Soviet–German Pact. At the behest of <a0_0><b3_0>Mikhail Gorbachev, Alexander Nikolaevich Yakovlev<b3_0/><a0_0/> headed a commission investigating the existence of such a protocol. In December 1989, the commission concluded that the protocol had existed and revealed its findings to the <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Congress of People's Deputies of the Soviet Union<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>. As a result, the Congress passed the declaration confirming the existence of the secret protocols, condemning and denouncing them. <a1_0><b4_0><b5_0>Both successor-states of the pact parties<b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> have declared the secret protocols to be invalid from the moment they were signed. The Federal Republic of Germany declared this on September 1, 1989 and the Soviet Union on December 24, 1989, following an examination of the microfilmed copy of the German originals.
